Network

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Network.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.util.Observable
    A Client is used to connect to the server. The client will receive and send data from the user to the game server. It processes everything and sends it to it's observer, MUDView. Whenever Client receives anything, it parses it and lets MUDView know what to do.
    Author:
    Michael Hogue

      Construct a new Client and attempt to connect to the server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String clientName,
      java.lang.String password,
      java.lang.String serverIP,
      java.lang.Integer serverPort,
      MainFrame mf)
        Construct a new Client and attempt to connect to the server. If connected, a LoginAttempt is sent immediately. A thread will be started to receive data.
        Parameters:
        clientName - - A string representation of the clients attempted username for login.
        password - - A string representation of the clients attempted password for login.
        serverIP - - The attempted IP of the server that the client wishes to connect to.
        serverPort - - The attempted port on the server that the client wishes to connect to.
        mf - - The clients MainFrame -- will be used to change views.

    • Method Detail

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Check if the client is connected to a server. Used to know whether or not the MUDView should be displayed, and in the ReceiveThread to avoid errors.
        Returns:
        The clients connected state to the server.

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(java.lang.String sendData)
        Send data to the server. Since the user can only type messages, only Strings will be sent to the server. The server will parse the string to figure out exactly what this client is attempting to do.
        Parameters:
        sendData - The message that the server will receive from the client. The message is always preceded by the clients name, a colon and a space.
